intro: Lathyrus zalaghensis, commonly known as the Zalagh pea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and trifoliate leaves. Its flowers are usually pale blue or violet, arranged in racemes, and bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is of interest to botanists due to its ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
